channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In a county that backed Trump, people dependent on Medicaid are conflicted about cuts
item.description: In an Arizona county that voted for Trump 2-to-1, many people rely on Medicaid, would hate to lose it, and are persuaded that there is fraud that can be cut from the program.
item.content:encoded: In an Arizona county that voted for Trump 2-to-1, many people rely on Medicaid, would hate to lose it, and are persuaded that there is fraud that can be cut from the program.
item.dc:creator: Noam Levey

item.title: Almost 200,000 Palestinians displaced by latest Israeli military offensive
item.description: Israel has ordered tens of thousand of Gazans to move to zone in the south
item.content:encoded: Israel has ordered tens of thousand of Gazans to move to zone in the south
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Susan Brownmiller, whose landmark book changed attitudes on rape, dies at 90
item.description: In 1975, Against Our Will: Men, Women and Rape explored pernicious cultural and legal attitudes about rape and helped debunk the long-held view that victims were partly to blame.
item.content:encoded:
In 1975, Against Our Will: Men, Women and Rape explored pernicious cultural and legal attitudes about rape and helped debunk the long-held view that victims were partly to blame.

(Image credit: Suzanne Vlamis)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: A video of the French president's wife shoving him went viral. Here's why it matters
item.description: Macron said that the video depicts the couple "joking" and dismissed it as part of a disinformation campaign. Experts say Russian accounts are trying to undermine his image as a strong advocate for the West.
item.content:encoded:
Macron said that the video depicts the couple "joking" and dismissed it as part of a disinformation campaign. Experts say Russian accounts are trying to undermine his image as a strong advocate for the West.

(Image credit: Hau Dinh)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 55-year-old Kami Rita Sherpa breaks his own record: climbing Mount Everest 31 times
item.description: Lumping his 31 feats together, Kami Rita Sherpa has climbed nearly 90,000 feet above sea level on the famous peak. He first climbed to the top of the world's highest mountain in 1994.
item.content:encoded:
Lumping his 31 feats together, Kami Rita Sherpa has climbed nearly 90,000 feet above sea level on the famous peak. He first climbed to the top of the world's highest mountain in 1994.

(Image credit: Prakash Mathema)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Elon Musk's Starship rocket loses altitude control on its 9th launch
item.description: Several dummy satellites were supposed to be launched, but a door on the ship did not open as planned.
item.content:encoded:
Several dummy satellites were supposed to be launched, but a door on the ship did not open as planned.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Despite the pause on high tariffs, Chinese factories still face high uncertainty
item.description: A 90-day pause on triple-digit U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods has left exporters and importers in a high state of uncertainty. Factory owners in China tell NPR that orders are down overall.
item.content:encoded:
A 90-day pause on triple-digit U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods has left exporters and importers in a high state of uncertainty. Factory owners in China tell NPR that orders are down overall.

(Image credit: Ng Han Guan)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: RFK Jr. says COVID shots no longer recommended for kids, pregnant women
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. announced that CDC recommendations for COVID vaccines will no longer include healthy pregnant women and healthy children.
item.content:encoded:
Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. announced that CDC recommendations for COVID vaccines will no longer include healthy pregnant women and healthy children.

(Image credit: Jane Tyska/Digital First Media/Media News Group)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Trump administration moves to cancel remaining federal funds to Harvard
item.description: A letter from the U.S. General Services Administration, which is dated Tuesday, tells agencies to submit a list of contracts they have terminated with the university by June 6.
item.content:encoded:
A letter from the U.S. General Services Administration, which is dated Tuesday, tells agencies to submit a list of contracts they have terminated with the university by June 6.

(Image credit: Zhu Ziyu)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: NPR and Colorado public radio stations sue Trump White House
item.description: NPR and three Colorado public radio stations are suing the Trump administration over the president's executive order seeking to ban the use of federal money for NPR and PBS.
item.content:encoded:
NPR and three Colorado public radio stations are suing the Trump administration over the president's executive order seeking to ban the use of federal money for NPR and PBS.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik
